com.coveros.selenified.element.check.wait

Class WaitForEquals

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coveros.selenified.element.check.WaitForEquals
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Equals

    public class WaitForEquals
extends Object
implements Equals
    WaitForEquals implements Equals to provide some additional wait capabilities. It will handle all waits performed on the actual element. These waits are custom to the framework, and in addition to providing easy object oriented capabilities, they take screenshots with each failed wait to provide additional traceability, and assist in troubleshooting and debugging failing tests. Equals checks that elements have a particular value associated to them.
    Version:
    3.2.0
    Author:
    Max Saperstone

      • changeDefaultWait

        public void changeDefaultWait(double seconds)
        Changes the default wait time from 5.0 seconds to some custom number.
        Parameters:
        seconds - - how many seconds should WaitFor wait for the condition to be met

      • changeDefaultPoll

        public void changeDefaultPoll(long milliseconds)
        Changes the default poll time from 500.0 milliseconds to some custom number.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - - how many milliseconds should WaitFor wait between pollings for the condition to be met

      • matches

        public void matches(int expectedMatches)
        Waits for the element has a the expected number of matches on the page, e.g. how many elements match the locator and target provided. The default wait time will be used and if the element doesn't have the desired match count at that time, it will fail, and log the issue with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.
        Specified by:
        matches in interface Equals
        Parameters:
        expectedMatches - the expected number of elements matching the locator

      • cssValue

        public void cssValue(String attribute,
                     String expectedValue)
        Waits for the element has a css attribute with a value equal to the value provided. If the element isn't present, or the css doesn't contain the desired attribute, this will constitute a failure, same as a mismatch. The default wait time will be used and if the element doesn't have the desired match count at that time, it will fail, and log the issue with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.
        Specified by:
        cssValue in interface Equals
        Parameters:
        attribute - - the css attribute to be checked
        expectedValue - the expected css value of the passed attribute of the element

      • clazz

        public void clazz(String expectedClass)

The default wait time will be used and if the element doesn't have the desired match count at that time, it will fail, and log the issue with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.
        Specified by:
        clazz in interface Equals
        Parameters:
        expectedClass - - the full expected class value

      • text

        public void text(int row,
                 int col,
                 String text)
        Waits for the element's text in a particular cell equals the provided expected text. If the element isn't present, or a table, this will constitute a failure, same as a mismatch. The default wait time will be used and if the element doesn't have the desired match count at that time, it will fail, and log the issue with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.
        Specified by:
        text in interface Equals
        Parameters:
        row - - the number of the row in the table - note, row numbering starts at 1, NOT 0
        col - - the number of the column in the table - note, column numbering starts at 1, NOT 0
        text - - what text do we expect to be in the table cell

      • isPresent

        public boolean isPresent(String check,
                         double waitFor)
        Determines if the element is present, and if it is not writes a failure out to the detailed log
        Parameters:
        check - - the check being performed
        waitFor - - if waiting, how long to wait for (set to 0 if no wait is desired)
        Returns:
        Boolean: whether the element is present or not

      • isPresentInput

        public boolean isPresentInput(String check,
                              double waitFor)
        Determines if the element is a present, and if it is, it is an input. Writes out the action and expected outcome to the detailed log. Action is only logged if waitFor is greater than 0 (implying we are waiting)
        Parameters:
        check - - the check being performed
        waitFor - - if waiting, how long to wait for (set to 0 if no wait is desired)
        Returns:
        Boolean: whether the element is a select or not

      • isPresentSelect

        public boolean isPresentSelect(String check,
                               double waitFor)

        public boolean isPresentTable(String check,

        Returns:

      • elementPresent

        public double elementPresent(double seconds)
        Performs a simple check for the element to be present. The provided wait time will be used and the total time the action took will be returned. Nohing will be logged, but this will be used as part of other methods.
        Parameters:
        seconds - - how many seconds to wait for
        Returns:
        double: the time waited
